contextId.information: This can start a new sentence: "Their genealogical records list them as" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: listed in their genealogical records

contextId.information: AT: "Genealogical records listed them all" or "The records of their family's ancestry listed them all" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All these were listed by genealogical records

contextId.information: AT: "It was the duty of their fellow workers, the Levites, to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Their associates, the Levites, were assigned to do

contextId.information: "the tribe of Zebulun gave Merari's descendants Rimmono with its pasturelands and Tabor with its pasturelands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Merari's ... pasturelands

contextId.information: AT: "The records in peoples' villages included the names of these men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Their names were recorded in the people's records in their villages

contextId.information: AT: "took care of" or "cared for" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were assigned to take care of

contextId.information: AT: "so David made Joab a commander" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so he was made a commander

contextId.information: AT: "Yahweh gave honor to David's kingdom to help the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his kingdom was exalted on high for the sake of his people Israel

contextId.information: AT: "the people of Israel had anointed David as their king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: David had been anointed as king over all Israel

contextId.information: AT: "David, the Levites, and the singers all wore fine linen robes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were the Levites who carried the ark, the singers, and Kenaniah, the leader of the song with the singers

contextId.information: AT: "David's men placed the crown on his head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The crown was set on David's head

contextId.information: AT: "But Joab did not count the men from the tribes of Levi and Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But Levi and Benjamin were not counted among them

contextId.information: AT: "than anyone could weigh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: than could be weighed

contextId.information: AT: "Yahweh chose Aaron to dedicate the most holy things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Aaron was chosen to set apart the most holy things

contextId.information: AT: "These were the names of Levi's descendants and their families, whom David's men counted and listed. They were the leaders of the clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: These were Levi's descendants corresponding to their clans. They were the leaders, counted and listed by name, of the clans

contextId.information: AT: "For David's last command was for his men to count the Levites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For by David's last words the Levites were counted

contextId.information: AT: "They chose one by lot from Eleazar's descendants, then they would choose by lot one from Ithamar's descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: One clan was drawn by lot from Eleazar's descendants, and then the next would be drawn from Ithamar's descendants

contextId.information: AT: "following the rules that Aaron their ancestor gave them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: following the procedure given to them by Aaron their ancestor

contextId.information: AT: "When they threw the lot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the lot was thrown

contextId.information: "Obed Edom was responsible for guarding the south gate, and his sons guarded the storehouses." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: To Obed Edom was assigned the south gate, and his sons were assigned the storehouses

contextId.information: AT: "4 men guarded the court to the west" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: At the court to the west there were four posted

contextId.information: AT: "They were" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They were filled with

contextId.information: "The leaders also selected guards from the clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: There were also guards drawn from the clans

contextId.information: AT: "their names were on the lists" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: counted from the lists

contextId.information: AT: "No one wrote this number down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This number was not written down

contextId.information: "that ate grass in the fields" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that were pastured

contextId.information: AT: "Someone wrote there the deeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Recorded there are the deeds
